abstract: Tech start-up Docker is pioneering new method of making software, called containers, that some are comparing in importance to emergence of Java programming language in 1990s; process ships applications across different cloud computing systems, and has been downloaded 70 million times; some of its clients are big companies, including ING and Goldman Sachs.
lead_paragraph: The start-up is in the forefront of a move to package applications much as shipping containers hold physical goods.
snippet: The start-up is in the forefront of a move to package applications much as shipping containers hold physical goods.

headline.main: Docker, a Software Start-Up, Sees a Future in Containers of Code
headline.print_headline: A Small Software Company Sees a Future in Containers of Code
